title: Accession Timeline (Your Personal Gantt)
summary: Build a simple timeline from today to accession milestones with deadlines and owners.
checklist: List required documents and suspense dates.
Assign an owner (you, recruiter, unit) for each item.
Review weekly until accession complete.

title: Fitness & Medical Readiness Plan
summary: Ensure fitness and readiness items won’t delay accession or training.
checklist: Confirm medical requirements and any waivers early.
Start an 8–12 week fitness plan aligned to standards.
Track appointments and paperwork in one place.

title: Documents Folder (One Source of Truth)
summary: Avoid last-minute scrambles by building a single, organized folder structure.
checklist: Create a folder with subfolders: IDs, transcripts, forms, correspondence.
Use consistent filenames with dates (YYYY-MM-DD).
Back up to a secure personal location.

title: Interview Prep: Role + Why MSC + Impact
summary: Be able to explain MSC value in 30 seconds with a concrete example.
checklist: Draft a 30-second role statement.
Prepare 3 leadership examples with outcomes.
Practice answering: 'Why MSC?' and 'Why now?'

title: Uniforms: Don’t Wait Until the Last Week
summary: Uniform delays are common; build buffer time.
checklist: Identify required uniforms for initial training.
Schedule measurements early.
Plan for tailoring time.

title: Pay & Benefits: Validate Early
summary: Know what to expect and who to contact if something is off.
checklist: Confirm pay entry baseline and special pay eligibility (if applicable).
Save points of contact.
Track first LES and verify accuracy.

title: PCS/Travel Planning Checklist
summary: Reduce friction by organizing travel and reporting instructions early.
checklist: Confirm reporting location/time and required documents.
Plan lodging and travel buffer.
Print/save critical emails and orders.

title: Professional Reading (Minimal, High Yield)
summary: Read a small set of authoritative sources; avoid internet rabbit holes.
checklist: Review official MSC overview and mission.
Skim DHA policy categories relevant to admin/ops.
Identify 3 policies to deep read once assigned.

title: Mentorship Map
summary: Identify 2–3 mentors (MSC, clinical, enlisted) and set a cadence.
checklist: Ask one MSC officer for monthly mentorship.
Find a senior enlisted mentor for ops perspective.
Prepare questions before each touchpoint.

title: First 30 Days Plan (Win Trust Early)
summary: Show you are there to learn fast and deliver value.
checklist: Schedule key stakeholder intros in week 1.
Ask: 'What’s the #1 pain point I can help with?'
Deliver one small, visible improvement by day 30.
